description: Sum of composite numbers between successive primes.
links: James Spahlinger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) = (prime(n+1) + prime(n))*(prime(n+1) - prime(n) - 1)/2, where prime(n) = A000040(n) is the n-th prime. - _Zak Seidov_, Sep 12 2002
example: Between 7 and 11 we have 8 + 9 + 10 which is a(4)=27.
mathematica: f[n_,x_]:=n*x+x*(x+1)/2;Table[f[Prime[n],Prime[n+1]-Prime[n]-1],{n,6!}] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Mar 21 2010 *)f[n_] := Block[{p0 = Prime[n], p1 = Prime[n + 1]}, (p1 + p0) (p1 - p0 - 1)/2]; Array[f, 54] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 28 2012 *)
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Apr 15 2000
